page.title: 16Roads in our area
page.content: The most important development in the road system in our area in recent years was the opening of the Canonbie by-pass in 1984. We did traffic surveys on the road through Canonbie village before and after the opening of the new road. Before the by-pass was built about 200 vehicles an hour passed through the village; after the by-pass about 80 vehicles an hour came through.{(see page 17 for by-pass) The by-pass forms part of the A7 trunk road from Carlisle to Edinburgh. The other major route in the area is the B6357 which is part of the Annan- Newcastleton-Jedburgh route. The old A7 road through Canonbie is now re-numbered as the B720. The A7 has a mixed load of lorries and private cars, many of them tourists in the summer. The B6357 carries a cons- iderable amount of forestry traffic.
